tweets.html:
Kiernan Shipka is in Legend of Korra?! So this 13 year-old is in both the best live action series and best animated series currently on TV.

— Jamiesen Borak (@that_darn_jbo) June 16, 2012

Remember when Josh Hartnett had the weirdest haircut for, roughly, 5 years? http://t.co/J5szzq5q

— Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) June 16, 2012

I'm amazed that some food company hasn't yet done a licensing deal to sell Great Muppet Capers.

— Tim Carvell (@timcarvell) June 16, 2012

Faith & Freedom Con is a Comic-Con that's intolerant of anyone who doesn't read the one shitty comic book they approve of.

— Frank Conniff (@FrankConniff) June 17, 2012

Fuck, marry, kill: Seth Cohen, Ryan Atwood, Sandy Cohen. Show your work.

— pilot (@pilotbacon) June 17, 2012

I'm reading James Joyce for 15 mins to counteract the 15 mins of Carly Rae Jepsen "Canadian Idol" performances I just watched.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) June 17, 2012

You guys, NBC is still airing new #TheFirm episodes. I kid you not. IT'S ON RIGHT NOW.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) June 17, 2012

I'd kill for a new Growing Pains episode right about now. Unaged cast. No Chrissy.

— Aisha Muharrar (@eeshmu) June 17, 2012

A slug line is an ugly name for a beautiful thing. Lovely little slug line, the only thing that doesnt give me trouble

— Mindy Kaling (@mindykaling) June 17, 2012

Twitter is weird RT @MollyRingwald: Quickly trying to read "50 Shades" before dinner with @BretEastonEllis.

— Matthew Garrahan (@MattGarrahan) June 17, 2012

"More Gina Torres" is a clever strategy to mask the "Bending Over Backwards to Continue to Justify Stupid Premise"-ness of #Suits, #Suits.

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) June 17, 2012

Idea for show. Nerd played by Seth Green becomes hottest lawyer in Cleveland by winning all his cases with savant-like breakdancing skills.

— Marvel's Infinity Waco (@johnwarrender) June 17, 2012

I think I want Amy Sherman-Palladino to write a movie about the Eurozone debt crisis.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) June 17, 2012

My one problem with LOUIE: why doesn't he just finish eating the slice of pizza while he walks to the comedy club? I would. #pizzatweets

— Gangly Uncoordinated Bitch (@craig_mcquinn) June 17, 2012

I learned how to spell Milo Ventimiglia's last name tonight. Now I can properly tell you how I feel about all the Gilmore Girls cast!

— Cameron White (@JediDusk) June 17, 2012

My 'Girls' trajectory. ep 1: I hate these people. Ep 2-5 I AM these people. Ep 6: I love these people.

— Julie Plec (@julieplec) June 17, 2012

Damian Lewis's mouth really bothers me. #Homeland

— tv observatory (@tvobservatory) June 17, 2012

"Fairly Legal" is not a good show, but I think I'm gay for Sarah Shahi?

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) June 17, 2012

DJ Tanner > DJ Connor

— Muffin MacGuffin🕯 (@MuffMacGuff) June 17, 2012

I often find myself asking: "Which episode of Buffy best applies to my current situation?" And the answer is almost always Beer Bad.

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) June 17, 2012

Most secret societies have hazing rituals less painful or humiliating than the pilot for "The Neighbors."

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) June 17, 2012

Will miss Mad Men tonight. I'm going to swing by the Walmart parking lot so I can watch some people smoke.

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) June 17, 2012

On the plus side, I don't have to get up and go to work for at least eight months. #MadMen

— Dawn Chambers (@SCDP_Dawn) June 18, 2012

I would love someone to come up with a cookbook with recipes from #TheWire. Homemade McNuggets! Yvette Levy's brisket!

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) June 17, 2012

How would we know? RT @MileyCyrus: Did I really sleep till 3 pm?

— Eli Braden (@EliBraden) June 17, 2012

Few TV things entertain me more than thinking about the cast of Family Matters watching a S1 recurring character take over their whole show.

— Devan Joneson (@djoneson) June 18, 2012

"You know that wacky nerd from episode 14? Yeah, he's taking half your screen time this season" #FamilyMatters

— Devan Joneson (@djoneson) June 18, 2012

damn the rating at the beginning of the episode spoiling that there will be violence and rape on The Borgias. #likeeveryotherweek

— D(oc) Oc(k) (@frittersandclam) June 18, 2012

Is Obama going to just sit there and do nothing about Adam Sandler? Lead, dammit!

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) June 16, 2012

Is it possible to make a parody Adam Sandler movie poster that would not be mistaken for a real Adam Sandler movie poster?

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) June 17, 2012

The dire openings of THAT'S MY BOY and ROCK OF AGES bode ill for movies that are total crap.

— Nathan Rabin (@nathanrabin) June 18, 2012

I imagine the execs behind THAT'S MY BOY reassuring each other "They just didn't respond to THIS particular horseshit. They still love crap"

— Nathan Rabin (@nathanrabin) June 18, 2012

Every time Guy Fieri appears on my TV, I try to physically force myself to go deaf. My ears never cooperate.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) June 18, 2012

Forget HBO, I would pay an extra $30 per month for a Tosh-free Comedy Central

— Todd Martens (@Toddmartens) June 18, 2012

I'm slowly coming to the realization that this iPad is becoming more of a distractor than a helper. - Sent from My iPad.

— Mark O. Estes (@theanticritic) June 18, 2012

Robert Downey Jr. seemed like a good Holmes at the time, but then Moffat gave us Cumberbatch and… *shrugs*

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) June 18, 2012

It's fun how watching TV has become another thing I feel stressed about needing to accomplish.

— Alex Blagg (@alexblagg) June 18, 2012

i think sorkin is a good writer who conned us into thinking he's a genius by using rat-a-tat screwball rhythms. more words is not better

— Julie Bush (@julie_bush) June 18, 2012

A mark of a bad show is its ability to destroy the hotness of a leading man. Recent victims: Alexander Skarsgard, Jon Rhys Meyers.

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) June 18, 2012

True Blood is just fucking with us now, right? #vampirebible

— Muto-Ho-Ho! (@JoeMuto) June 18, 2012

Nelsan Ellis is KILLING me tonight. I still want a spin-off of Lafayette & Pam. #TrueBlood

— Tim (@rural_juror) June 18, 2012

#TrueBlood isn't a show that should be doing PTSD stories. Ever.

— Wes Ambrecht (@iamwesley) June 18, 2012

So it seems like #TrueBlood has decided to stop being actively dumb and started being actively boring. Well, that's.... a change.

— MavisGaryVEVO (@MisterMcCracken) June 18, 2012

"Not only did I find you very creepy, I found you really boring" is the new "He cannot hit, however, neither can he field." #GirlsHBO

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) June 18, 2012

#Girls joins the short list of shows I wish were on 52 weeks a year.

— Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) June 18, 2012

Chris O'Dowd in #Girls looks freakishly like the 2012 version of Hart Bochner in Die Hard.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) June 18, 2012

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
Man, #GIRLS really sneaked up on me. I truly love it. Gonna miss it while it's away. Great thing you did there, @lenadunham

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) June 18, 2012

The second half of GIRLS S1, including the finale, was amazing. Surprising, tonally varied, weird, funny. Worth the time investment.

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) June 18, 2012

I hope Hannah from Girls wins the next "Best TV Villain" poll.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) June 18, 2012

AMC has a clock in the upper-right corner counting to The Killing finale. I too have been eagerly waiting for it to be over.

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) June 17, 2012

After tonight, you'll be able to tell your kids where you were when you learned who killed Rosie Larsen. They won't care.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) June 17, 2012

@HitFixDaniel “Rosie Larsen? Son, I was skimming a recap on my phone after the show.”

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) June 17, 2012

Finally tonight we find out who killed Laura Palmer

— Ted Linhart (@TedOnTV) June 17, 2012

Twist: it was NOT the butler RT @TedOnTV: Finally tonight we find out who killed Laura Palmer

— Cameron White (@JediDusk) June 17, 2012

Finally find out who killed old whatshername on #TheKilling tonite.

— david carr (@carr2n) June 17, 2012

packing a go bag in case we don't find out who killed Rosie tonight and I have to pull a Midge and abandon my family #TheKilling

— Sara Schaefer (@saraschaefer1) June 18, 2012

If I had to guess who killed Rosie Larsen, I'd say Ichiro Suzuki. He's been way too quiet.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) June 18, 2012

Dear Twitter: Please spoil me on who killed Rosie Larsen, because I am totally not watching that show.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) June 18, 2012

Continuing a string of bad Sunday night press, tonight we learn that Rosie Larsen was killed by a Jaguar executive.

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) June 18, 2012

Pretty excited for how dissapointed I will be after the season finale of #TheKilling tonight.

— Evan Kirby (@evankirby) June 18, 2012

I'm glad Rosie Larsen died. There, I said it. #TheKilling

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) June 18, 2012

@mousterpiece @televisionary @KateAurthur If Veena Sud *was* revealed as the killer, that would be the greatest TV ending ever.

— Christopher Dole (@chrisdole86) June 18, 2012

Actual line an actor was just forced to say on The Killing: "The press will have a field day with this."

— Mark Harris (@MarkHarrisNYC) June 18, 2012

Reading tweets about The Killing is like reading tweets about a timeshare pitch I skipped. I feel for you, but better you than me.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) June 18, 2012

I feel like a RENT song should be playing now. #TheKilling

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) June 18, 2012

Old Man Withers?!?!? #TheKilling #WouldHaveGottenAwayWithItToo #MeddlingKids #NotaSpoiler

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) June 18, 2012

Clearly THE KILLING is based on the original Danish series "Scööby-Döö."

— Andy Greenwald (@andygreenwald) June 18, 2012

Did you ever find a key to a safety deposit box and wait a year to open it and discover one M&M inside? #TheKilling

— Mark Harris (@MarkHarrisNYC) June 18, 2012

IT WAS ALL ONE GIANT COINCIDENCE. Oh Vena! #thekilling

— Blerg (@MediaObsessed) June 18, 2012

Great #TheKilling twist. Totally unfounded by character's actions over the last two seasons but if the writers don't care, I won't either

— Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) June 18, 2012

It's a shame the know-it-alls can't let us enjoy #TheKilling finale by telling us how obvious it was & thus, what idiots we are. #suckit

— Curt Wagner (@ShowPatrol) June 18, 2012

Only positives to come from #TheKilling are Mireille Enos & Joel Kinnaman becoming popular enough to snag big film roles #Robocop #WorldWarZ

— Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) June 18, 2012

Oh, ok, and The Killing ends with a lost version of the "Call Me Maybe" video.

— Willa Paskin (@willapaskin) June 18, 2012

I wish it had ended with Linden walking into a laundrymat and washing her sweater. #thekilling

— Blerg (@MediaObsessed) June 18, 2012

Shrug. #TheKilling

— Ellen Gray (@elgray) June 18, 2012

Season 2 finale of The Killing: Not terrible.

— Person of Mattress (@digifreak642) June 18, 2012

We need to talk about #thekilling b/c most of the finale was a reaction shot. #soapoperasforthewin

— Courtney Brannon Donoghue (@Courtney_BD) June 18, 2012

Veena Sud's only logical excuse for this travesty is Bath Salts.

— Andy Greenwald (@andygreenwald) June 18, 2012

What's a guy gotta do to get intentionally spoiled on #TheKilling finale, Twitter? I always get spoiled on shows I care about...

— Mark W. (@marqualler) June 18, 2012

Dish Network killed Rosie Larsen. #TheKilling

— Reed Kavner (@reedkavner) June 18, 2012

Reading #TheKilling tweets and I can't figure out the difference between real spoilers and sarcasm. #whokilledRosieLarsen

— Jennifer Schaefer (@jlschaefer) June 18, 2012

I can't believe Rosie Larsen was killed by Lena Dunham's lack of black characters on "Girls."

— Miles Kahn (@mileskahn) June 18, 2012

I felt sort of like Linden at the end of The Killing - that's it? You know without all the "I'm a tortured (insane?) detective" baggage.

— Kathleen Battles (@katbat67) June 18, 2012

THE KILLING definitely outfoxed me. I never would have guessed that they ALL did it.

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) June 18, 2012

Season 3 of the The Killing will focus on Linden's investigation of who stole her favorite mud-colored pullover.

— Mark Harris (@MarkHarrisNYC) June 18, 2012
